body_text.text: Supplemental Table 1 : Medical history and summary of the key findings in two individuals who were found to have evidence of SARS-CoV-2 in at throat swab. All dates refer to the year 2020.  Afebrile in all screenings and during hospital observation.
 No laboratory abnormalities except for anemia (hemoglobin 11.8 g/dl).
 Does not recall contact with a confirmed case of COVID-19.

 44-year-old female  Recalled having had a whole body rash between January 21st and 23rd, non-itching, in combination with myalgia and cephalgia. Recalls having had a temperature of 38 degrees once.
 Recalls having had a dry cough and itchy throat on January 25 th . Denies having had dyspnea and chest pain.
 Recalls having had otalgia on January 28th, started taking amoxicillin for three days for presumed ear infection on that day.
 February 1 st : Evacuation flight to Germany, passes medical assessment, throat swab taken.

 February 2 nd : Admitted to Department of Infectious Disease at the University Hospital Frankfurt after throat swab found evidence of SARS-CoV-2  At the hospital, slight rash on her chest and legs is noticed. Minimal inflammation on throat examination.
 Afebrile and normal vital signs in all screenings and during hospital observation.
 Laboratory values unremarkable during hospital stay.
 Does not recall contact with a confirmed case of COVID-19.  Continuous monitoring in flight by physicians.

 Triage in the medical assessment center at Frankfurt Airport A) Patients were asked to report current symptoms of cough, runny nose, sore throat, fever, muscle ache, diarrhea and fatigue; parents were asked to report symptoms observed in their children. B) Brief exam by a physician, including the inspection of the throat, nose and breathing.
C) Temperature was taken and recorded. D) Consent for SARS-CoV-2 testing was obtained.
 Cohort was transported to the site of quarantine.

BIBREF0.title: Detection of 2019 novel coronavirus (2019-nCoV) by real-time RT-PCR

Supplemental Figure 2: Electron microscopic image justifying coronavirus in the supernatant of the sample of patient A.

FIGREF2.text: January 20 th : Starts trip to Wuhan, China; via Bremen, Munich, and Beijing. Stayed in Wuhan.  February 1 st : Evacuation flight to Germany, passes medical assessment, throat swab taken.  February 2 nd : Admitted to Department of Infectious Disease at the University Hospital Frankfurt after throat swab found evidence of SARS-CoV-Did not recall any symptoms typical for any flu like illness or infection of the respiratory tract during the last weeks.
